prompt.transcript:
Patient attended my gynae clinic today following internal referral by my colleague with scan finding of 5 cm complex right ovarian cyst suspicious of
dermoid. This referral I note was made in early 2024. She is a 56 years of age and
nulliparous. She does not report any abdominal pain but I note that the scan was
undertaken as part of a regular surveillance for BRCA gene mutation. She is
menopausal and reports no abnormal bleeding but has Mirena coil in situ for 5 years for
management of heavy periods. Her cervical smear is in date and negative.
She has a history of the chronic immune thrombocytopenia and a previous laparotomy
and removal of one ovary years' ago for large cyst suspicious of dermoid. She is not on
any medication and has no history of drug allergy. She is in a stable relationship and
does not smoke.
Her last imaging report I can see on the system was a scan undertaken in
September 2020 that confirmed a 5 cm complex right ovarian cyst suspicious of dermoid.
There is no up-to-date tumour markers. In view of her history, I have put in a request for
a pelvic MRI and also requested serum CA 125. I will review her with the investigation
results. If necessary, her case will be reviewed at the gynae-oncology MDT meeting
